segments.text: I notice the contrast between the neat garden outside and the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so focused on her task that she doesn’t see the overflowing water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost comical how serious she looks while everything else is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then I feel a surge of frustration; how can she not see it?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are trying to pull off this little heist, and I can’t help but feel anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is practically balancing on the edge of disaster, and it makes my stomach turn.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about how easily kids can get hurt in situations like this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Their excitement is palpable, and it’s hard not to smile at their antics.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I can’t shake the worry as the boy stretches further toward the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why is no one paying attention to the very real dangers present?
segments.speaker: PAR
